results.content: This was extraordinarily basic. After going through HTML/CSS on code academy and codecamp, and taking another udemy course that was thorough and truly to the advanced level as advertised, this  was not "to Pro" as advertised. The lecturer also used IE through the whole course. Does he hate himself? Is this 1997? I feel I just wasted my hard-earned money.

results.content: The course is simple, direct and fluid.

results.content: Excellent for beginners, if you want clear, practical explanations this is the course for you.  Will be a great reference for any one learning HTML and CSS.
results.content_html: Excellent for beginners, if you want clear, practical explanations this is the course for you. Will be a great reference for any one learning HTML and CSS.

results.content:
I'm new to web development, and I took the instrcutors other course on ASP.NET - which didn't really touch much HTML (which the instructor said he did on purpose as the two should be taught seperatly).

I wasn't sure at first, but having taken this course I understand why he did it - and I enjoyed this course a lot!

It really does assume no prior knowledge and took me through the basics a bit at a time with fully worked examples, finishing with a complete walkthough of building the Microsoft website front page.
results.content_html:

results.content:
I really enjoyed this course.

The instructor takes you through all the basics building up as he's goes along.
I liked how he seperated HTML from the CSS and this allowed me to get to grips with one thing at once.

The project at the end was really useful, as it allowed me to practice the concepts on a real world site.

Thank you!

Very informative, I like the small tests that you need to do before the next section, it realy helps you to learn even more than expected.
Excellent value for your money!
